member.name: T:Newtonsoft.Json.Schema.FormatHandling
member.summary: Specifies how the format keyword is handled when validating schemas.

member.name: F:Newtonsoft.Json.Schema.FormatHandling.Default
member.summary: The format keyword uses the default behavior for the schema version. In draft 2019-09 and earlier, failures are asserted, and result in a validation error. In draft 2020-12 and later, failures are treated as annotations, and don't cause a validation error.

member.name: F:Newtonsoft.Json.Schema.FormatHandling.Annotation
member.summary: The format keyword is evaluated as an annotation. Newtonsoft.Json.Schema doesn't support annotations so it skips running the format keyword.

member.name: F:Newtonsoft.Json.Schema.FormatHandling.Assertion
member.summary: The format keyword is evaluated as an assertion. Failure causes a validation error.

member.summary: Use the assembly qualified .NET type name as the schema Id.

member.name: M:Newtonsoft.Json.Schema.Infrastructure.EmailHelpers.Validate(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Validate the specified email address.

remarks.para: Validates the syntax of an email address.
If is true, then the validator will use the newer International Email standards for validating the email address.

member.returns: true if the email address is valid; otherwise false.
member.param: An email address.
true if the validator should allow international characters; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Newtonsoft.Json.Schema.Infrastructure.ObjectConstructor`1
member.summary: Represents a method that constructs an object.

members.member:
Determines whether the specified MemberInfo can be read.
The MemberInfo to determine whether can be read. /// if set to true then allow the member to be gotten non-publicly.
true if the specified MemberInfo can be read; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Newtonsoft.Json.Schema.Infrastructure.ReflectionUtils.CanSetMemberValue(System.Reflection.MemberInfo,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified MemberInfo can be set.
member.param: The MemberInfo to determine whether can be set.
if set to true then allow the member to be set non-publicly.
if set to true then allow the member to be set if read-only.
member.returns: true if the specified MemberInfo can be set; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Newtonsoft.Json.Schema.JSchemaWriterReferenceHandling
member.summary: Specifies reference handling options when writing schemas.

member.name: F:Newtonsoft.Json.Schema.JSchemaWriterReferenceHandling.Always
member.summary: Always write references to previously encountered schemas.

member.name: F:Newtonsoft.Json.Schema.JSchemaWriterReferenceHandling.Never
member.summary: Never write references to previously encountered schemas. Writing a schema with a recursive relationship will error.

member.name: F:Newtonsoft.Json.Schema.JSchemaWriterReferenceHandling.Auto
member.summary: Never write references to previously encountered schemas unless there is a recursive relationship, in which case a reference will be written.

member.name: T:Newtonsoft.Json.Schema.License
member.summary: Manages the license used with Json.NET Schema. A license can be purchased at http://www.newtonsoft.com/jsonschema.

member.name: M:Newtonsoft.Json.Schema.License.RegisterLicense(System.String)
member.summary: Register the specified license with Json.NET Schema. A license can be purchased at http://www.newtonsoft.com/jsonschema.
member.param: The license text to register.
member.remarks: The recommended way to register the license key is to call once during application start up. In ASP.NET web applications it can be placed in the Startup.cs or Global.asax.cs, in WPF applications it can be placed in the Application.Startup event, and in Console applications it can be placed in the static void Main(string[] args) event.

member.name: M:Newtonsoft.Json.Schema.License.HasRegisteredLicense
member.summary: Get a flag indicating whether license has been registered. A license is registered using .
member.returns: true if a license has been registered; otherwise false.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that an output will not be null even if the corresponding type allows it.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullWhenAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that when a method returns , the parameter will not be null even if the corresponding type allows it.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullWhenAttribute.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes the attribute with the specified return value condition.
member.param: The return value condition. If the method returns this value, the associated parameter will not be null.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullWhenAttribute.ReturnValue
member.summary: Gets the return value condition.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullIfNotNullAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that the output will be non-null if the named parameter is non-null.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullIfNotNullAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes the attribute with the associated parameter name.
member.param: The associated parameter name. The output will be non-null if the argument to the parameter specified is non-null.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullIfNotNullAttribute.ParameterName
member.summary: Gets the associated parameter name.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MaybeNullAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that an output may be null even if the corresponding type disallows it.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.AllowNullAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that null is allowed as an input even if the corresponding type disallows it.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DoesNotReturnAttribute
member.summary: Applied to a method that will never return under any circumstance.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DoesNotReturnIfAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that the method will not return if the associated Boolean parameter is passed the specified value.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DoesNotReturnIfAttribute.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The condition parameter value. Code after the method will be considered unreachable by diagnostics if the argument to the associated parameter matches this value.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DoesNotReturnIfAttribute.ParameterValue
member.summary: Gets the condition parameter value.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MemberNotNullAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that the method or property will ensure that the listed field and property members have not-null values.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MemberNotNullAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes the attribute with a field or property member.
member.param: The field or property member that is promised to be not-null.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MemberNotNullAttribute.#ctor(System.String[])
member.summary: Initializes the attribute with the list of field and property members.
member.param: The list of field and property members that are promised to be not-null.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MemberNotNullAttribute.Members
member.summary: Gets field or property member names.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MemberNotNullWhenAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that the method or property will ensure that the listed field and property members have not-null values when returning with the specified return value condition.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MemberNotNullWhenAttribute.#ctor(System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes the attribute with the specified return value condition and a field or property member.
member.param: The return value condition. If the method returns this value, the associated parameter will not be null.
The field or property member that is promised to be not-null.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MemberNotNullWhenAttribute.#ctor(System.Boolean,System.String[])
member.summary: Initializes the attribute with the specified return value condition and list of field and property members.
member.param: The return value condition. If the method returns this value, the associated parameter will not be null.
The list of field and property members that are promised to be not-null.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MemberNotNullWhenAttribute.ReturnValue
member.summary: Gets the return value condition.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MemberNotNullWhenAttribute.Members
member.summary: Gets field or property member names.
